org.itadaki.bzip2

Class BZip2BlockCompressor

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.itadaki.bzip2.BZip2BlockCompressor

  • public class BZip2BlockCompressor
extends java.lang.Object
    Compresses and writes a single BZip2 block

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BZip2BlockCompressor(BZip2BitOutputStream bitOutputStream, int blockSize) 

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Compresses and writes out the block

      Gets the CRC of the completed block.

      Determines if any bytes have been written to the block

    • Constructor Detail

      • BZip2BlockCompressor

        public BZip2BlockCompressor(BZip2BitOutputStream bitOutputStream,
                    int blockSize)
        Parameters:
        bitOutputStream - The BZip2BitOutputStream to which compressed BZip2 data is written
        blockSize - The declared block size in bytes. Up to this many bytes will be accepted into the block after Run-Length Encoding is applied

    • Method Detail

      • write

        public boolean write(int value)
        Writes a byte to the block, accumulating to an RLE run where possible
        Parameters:
        value - The byte to write
        Returns:
        true if the byte was written, or false if the block is already full

      • write

        public int write(byte[] data,
        int offset,
        int length)
        Writes an array to the block
        Parameters:
        data - The array to write
        offset - The offset within the input data to write from
        length - The number of bytes of input data to write
        Returns:
        The actual number of input bytes written. May be less than the number requested, or zero if the block is already full

      • close

        public void close()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Compresses and writes out the block
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - on any I/O error writing the data

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Determines if any bytes have been written to the block
        Returns:
        true if one or more bytes has been written to the block, otherwise false

      • getCRC

        public int getCRC()
        Gets the CRC of the completed block. Only valid after calling close()
        Returns:
        The block's CRC
